column4: -rwxr-xr-x <---- can anyone tell me the groupings? user group all? confused
ie; you, your friends, the world
and btw, that is mode 755 that you have displayed in your example
so based on that example, user has rwx, group has r-xx, and other has r-x
well, group has r-x, but yes, that's correct
The initial - indicates a "plain file" and has nothing to do with the permissions themselves.
It will be replaced with d for directory, c for block device, p for named pipe, and so on
ah, another common one is l for symbolic link
so if i wanted to give a command to everyone i could just sudo chmod ugo+x /bin/<command>
Ah, you can use "a" synonymously with "ugo" so that command can be written as "chmod a+x", but yes, that's more or less correct.
